website_summaries.verdict: 22 pieces that provide shine and versatility when it comes to a polished car.
pros: Great for its ability to clean a car's hardest to clean crevasse
Buffing pads wash up easily and can be used multiple times
Customers are routinely impressed with ease of use and results
One of the most adaptable buffing kits available

customer_reviews.title: product as described. used with griots polisher and chemical ...
customer_reviews.text: product as described. used with griots polisher and chemical guys 4 step polishing compounds. will order again.
customer_reviews.author: s. lee willson

customer_reviews.title: Great foam pads
customer_reviews.text: They work great for my purpose. I used it to restore my wife's car headlights, and removed most of the fogginess except the corners as is hard to reach. I will need to remove headlights to do the corners, but I really recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this to restore a set of headlights with mother's chrome polish. It gets the job done but is kinda a 1 and done deal. It takes about 3-4 minutes per light, by the time I was finishing with one light there was orange foam flying around but to be fair to the product the tits on the headlights that are used for aiming tears out little chunks. If it was a slick surface the pad would probably hold up a lot longer. They served my purpose and didn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: MC Tires n Service

customer_reviews.title: Work great for headlight restoration
customer_reviews.text: Used one of these pads to restore some old headlights. I have a 2002 silverado that had foggy and uggly headlights. I used one of these pads on my battery powered drill. I used a scratch and swirl remover compound made by turtle wax. The stuff has some type of small beads or particles that basically sand of the surface crude. I finished them off with mothers mag and aluminum polish. Did a great job. Also tried it on the side window's that were all nasty and foggy with water marks. It did make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Big abe

customer_reviews.title: Work great for headlights and small car panels!
customer_reviews.text: They just arrived today and I've already put them to use. Used in conjunction with chemical guys products to polish the headlights. After that I decided to try them out on some scratches that my car had and they worked great there too. I've read a lot of horror stories about potentially damaging a car if not using a DA polisher but they worked great and car looks great. I can see these really coming in handy on my Jeep where the body panels are smaller and traditional polisher might be a little bulky. Only downside is that holding a drill for extended periods of time is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from - this is a horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: Stay very far away from. Absolute junk. Used for the first time today. And nearly screwed up my paint on my car because the foam pad backing just came off. Flew accross the garage. The glue and the actual foam itself, is a cheap chinese made product. Its something you would find in your .99 cent store for pot scrubbing for your kitchen. This is really cheaply made. The foam material is crap. Stay far away from
customer_reviews.author: brad kalinoski

customer_reviews.title: CLEAR HEADLIGHTS
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier. Had a broken headlight replaced and hated the old faded one not replaced. Decided to try sandpaper and Plastx to try to clean it before spending unneeded $$$ to replace it also. Used orange and then yellow. The photo is a little before I was completely finished cleanup, hence the white residue. The pads polished perfectly and to my surprise washed up with plain water and dried up like new. Highly recommend them. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Look for another product, this one is useless
customer_reviews.text: This kit is worthless. Everyone of the pads I used fell apart after a few minutes of use. The glue holding the pads to the velcro looses its adhesion rather quickly if you have to apply any pressure which is necessary to remove oxidation with polishing compound.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: This product, although inexpensive, did the job I expected. I had a passenger window on a used truck that had somehow gotten chemically etched and frosted. With this kit and some ceramic cooktop polish, I was able to remove enough of the etch to see through that window again. I also used the same combo to clear up the plastic headlight lenses that had fogged over the years. Very satisfied with the quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price! For people having issues, the only advice I have is to learn to let the machine do the work. They're 3" pads. They're not designed to clear off 15 years of oxidation on the hood of your car by pushing a hard as you can. I've used these in the chuck of my drills and also used them on my Porter Cable 7346SP and they work fantastic. Know your application and your equipment's limitations...
customer_reviews.author: Jack H

customer_reviews.title: Velcro backing adhesive sucks
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive keeping the velcro attached immediately started to peel off. Then the polishing compound started to weaken the adhesive until it fell right off. I had to reattach it with cement glue and several screws so it won't come off again. As a result, the velcro no longer grabs the pads very well and I have to hold it against the surface or the pad can fall off. This all happened after very little use.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Right Tool for Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for tight areas around license plate & emblems. Removed clear coat scratches in small tight curved area next to license plate. I used the wavy orange pad with HD Speed. This was after doing the whole car with my 6 inch diameter machine & still finding scratches in tight areas. This set worked quickly, also plan to use on headlight lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Masuda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap for a reason. After 1 use and 1 wash the backing that attaches to the buffing plate fell off all but 2 pads. Im sure the other 2 pads wont last long either. Don't waste your money on these horrible pads. Spend the extra money and get some 3m pads. I have some 3m pads that are years old and are just fine. Cheap Chinese junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Decals Express

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used pads to apply both wax and scratch/swirl remover. While apply with fine pads more swirl marks were created and a bigger problem made then I originally had. Was applying wax coating to help with hard water spotting and what I got was swirl marks and scratches. The one scratch I was trying to remove also with the medium pad now seams minor compared to what these left behind. Use with caution and don't expect the seller to be of any help
customer_reviews.author: shotty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Compared to purchasing an expensive buffer, these pads work great on my new brushless drill. I've waxed 3 cars with these pads so far and I could not imagine my life without them. Very cool product and will be buying again once all my pads are used up.
customer_reviews.author: ak47u

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed.. didn't fit my drill (and should specify what it will work with)
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed that this didn't fit my pretty DeWalt drill. Before ordering, I looked all over trying to find out if it would fit, but alas nowhere does it specify working with a specific type of drill.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Made all scratches dissappear like nothing happened i bought turtle polishing and rubbing compound ...
customer_reviews.text: Made all scratches dissappear like nothing happened i bought turtle polishing and rubbing compound with this from amazon and it worked out wonderful.. highly recommend best 13$ i hve spent.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: What a great deal this is. Everything needed in one package, quite an assortment. No worries with this seller or the products. I will purchase from again when needing more pads.
customer_reviews.author: Whisky

customer_reviews.title: Quality product...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little kit, great for car window pillars and spot buffing. Lots cheaper than Chemical Guys Here's an update... I took the "protective" coating off a pair of eyeglasses as it started to peel. It was stubborn, so I had to use sandpaper...2500 grit was the finest I had. Hand compounding with Meguir's compound worked but left a haze. Although not what I bought these for, i tried the orange pad and it worked great. No more haze and some of the deep scratches nearly disappeared. Finished with the Meguir's polish on the yellow pad, and all of a sudden, I'm brilliant ;-)
customer_reviews.author: joseph d

customer_reviews.title: Ruined the paint on my 2015 Camaro it’s going to cost $500 to fix
customer_reviews.text: Ruined the paint on my 2015 Camaro it’s going to cost $500 to fix
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great for making swirl marks
customer_reviews.text: Looking for the ideal product to make swirl marks.. Then get these.
customer_reviews.author: Power Wheelz - Custom Wheelchair

customer_reviews.title: great price, quality and selection of polishing foam
customer_reviews.text: lots of choices in foam coarseness. This is actually 2 complete kits. This is quality buffing equipment for a good price the drill arbors are nice and will outlast the foam pads. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: Use these with my D/A Polisher and for the money they can’t be beat especially offering 2 Drill shank pads and 2 wool polishing bonnets. I haven’t used them long enough to comment on durability but honestly for the price if I can get 1/2 dozen or more jobs per pad I am happy. Obviously the orange pads are going g to wear quicker as they are used more for HD polishing.
customer_reviews.author: read2lead

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to clean a chemical stained stainless sink
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to use with my drill and some soft scrub Bar Keepers Friend. I have had a seriously stained sink for 2 years after using harsh chemicals to unclog a drain. I tried to scrub it clean by hand, but no luck so I ordered and used this kit along with the sink cleaner and my stainless sink is sparkling clean and shiny. It took 3 passes, but saved me a load of money since my sink looks like new! I'm going to use it on my calcium rings on my toilet next (we have very hard well water).
customer_reviews.author: jodeef

customer_reviews.title: Great buffing pads
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but hey for 10.00 what do yo have to loose. Using ONE Orange pad, I used Meguiar's Ultra Cut compound and did an entire Tundra CrewMax. The pad still basically looks like new. You do have to be careful around plastic trim because it can tear the pads, but you shouldn't be buffing these things anyway. Definitely high quality and if you use them properly, you can get a lot of use out of them. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Gen. Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Pad adhesive comes off. Throw away
customer_reviews.text: Pad that holds the sponge part separated on 1st use. The glue must melt off when wet. So, you can’t wash them which makes these useless. With advanced adhesives today this should not happen.
customer_reviews.author: michael rosse

customer_reviews.title: Great, Simple set to buff out scratches.
customer_reviews.text: I have four cars in my drive way and two teenage drivers. I bought this and a nice wax to help buff out all the scratches we get on our cars. This is NOT a whole car buffing wheel kind of thing - it would take forever, but it works GREAT at buffing out scratches and de-oxidizing the headlights. All of my cars have crisp, clear headlight lens. I use it with both a corded and cordless screwdriver - works well with both.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K. Preece

customer_reviews.title: Two complete pad sets and bases for detailing
customer_reviews.text: Two complete sets for detailing. I used them on a cordless buffer but it can be used with a drill (just not as fast to get the job done). So far the pads are holding up well. This is a great set for home use. Set comes with different grades of firmness and you can switch pad colors to adjust the level of cutting you want to do for removing scratches. Be sure to pickup some good polishing compounds and polish, I used the ones from Mcguiars
customer_reviews.author: WAC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Works well. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Are used one of these pads to apply the sink polisher to a very old sink. It helps the polish work very well. There are multiple pads with different surfaces. All of them fit by hook and loop to the base which attaches to your drill. The whole attachment system is very sturdy and I didn’t have any problem with anything coming unstuck while I was using it. The package I got had two sets in it. I don’t think I’ll ever have to buy another one of these. The pad that I used washed out very well so that I could use that again for something else.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazonCH

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, product is poorly made and does not last. Very cheap China made product. Shop around people.
customer_reviews.author: Trust & Verify

customer_reviews.title: Car Foam Drill Polishing Pad Kit 22 PCS, 3 Inch Buffing Pads
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit for a few polishing jobs around the house one of witch was my car head lights lens yellowing and fading. I only used a couple of the pads so far one for polishing compound and one for wax. The pads held up great and are the perfect size for task [which came out great]. I wash out the pads when finished so they will be ready to use again. Perfect for my needs and with the 22 pcs kit I purchased I should be all set for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Northeasterner

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement pads for polishers
customer_reviews.text: Used with Milwaukee 12v polisher with 3ah or bigger battery (critical), these are great replacements once the initial sample set that comes with the tool powders away. They dry out more quickly with compounds than the stock pads, so be careful if using in second gear on plastic car lights. I wouldn’t use them on drills, for obvious reasons: too heavy/large of tool, too inefficient with battery due to bearing friction, and too slow of speed (2k rpm on my m18fuel) would make these a battery and time sucking tedious process.
customer_reviews.author: Solutions engineering

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Great value too. I gave four stars for durability cause I have only used one of the foam pads so far. It was the flat orange one. Used it on two sets of headlights and one set was really yellow. I could probably get another two uses out of it easy. I think it also may be more about the headlights than the pad its self. One set has a protrusion not just smooth surface, but would definitely buy again. Plus you get double of everything! Overall It is Five star.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SUPRISED!
customer_reviews.text: at this price and zero brand name id expect 1 shot and done quality but i gotta say im pretty impressed! i bought this to buff out the headlights on my porsche 993 and i hooked it to a new dewalt angle drill and really gave it hell all day... end result? ZERO DAMAGE! the pads still look good as new after 5 hours of use on multiple projects
customer_reviews.author: 2ndEmpireMedia

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to use with my Black & Decker 20v cordless drill to polish my headlights. They did not disappoint. They even wash up easy and can be reused. The only thing that puzzled me was the description of the pads by the seller on Amazon. The white pads I received were definitely not fine, but course. They were courser than the orange ones. Other than that, nice set of pads to use on occasion for light jobs and they worked great to polish out my faded and foggy headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Emidio Scarfogliero

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value and durability
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. I had received a free aquarium for the kids, but years of neglect had left the glass etched and milky. Used this kit and Cerium oxide to quickly polish it back up. I only used one orange wheel for this and after polishing a 30 gallon glass tank and lid (and our glass top stove, since I already had the polish out) the wheel sill looks new and I have plenty left for other projects. Thinking shower glass, minor paint repairs, headlight and taillight cleaning... pretty limitless options.
customer_reviews.author: Nate S

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: I used a few of the pads to polish my headlights. I thought for sure the foam ones would fall apart. No issues at all. I used the same ones on 4 different headlights and they are still ready for more. I was shocked to get 2 sets of pads as well. Good Price for some good pads. Do it!! hit the buy now button!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Great value, quality kit!
customer_reviews.text: Used with "plastic polish" to polish my headlights on 2008 Ford Expedition. The pads were perfect, fit my drill perfectly and performed well. Did not wear out under heavy use. The let down was the plastic polish I used these with which just did not cut to the degree I was looking for, and it is not the pad kit's fault. Would I purchase this kit again, and for other applications, certainly- there is a lot of value here- you get a lot of options for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hokie115

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I used orbital buffer 6 inch pads for major detail. Often there are areas of car that need some paint correction and these are good alternative. Fast and easy to pop on drill and as long as it is not entire car + would take forever) gets job done. Areound corners, truck area , etc. Not sure if they will last but for the price and quality who cars. Used white with mcquires ultimate polish with cordless drill and results were good. Also great for in home use, stainless , countertops, shower fixtures etc
customer_reviews.author: MylesD

customer_reviews.title: Works great on minor scratches
customer_reviews.text: Pics say it all! My husband cleaned our car a while back and used the abrasive side of a kitchen sponge and now the whole car (blue one in pics) is covered in tiny surface scratches. You can clearly see the difference in the test spot on the paint and headlights. Not sure how long sponges will last since I need to do the whole car, but fingers crossed. The drill part sometimes comes unscrewed from piece that attaches to drill, but still good for the price. Used with Meguiars 105 ultra cut compound.
customer_reviews.author: kjski86

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - great price
customer_reviews.text: The buffing kit arrived the next day. Using pads to buff out oxidation on boat - needed smaller pads to get into corners and tight spots. I've only used one pad so far and its holding up great - will probably try others to see how they do - but extremely satisfied with the whole kit. I will also be using to detail my car - Awesome - will buy again if/when I need to
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: I used these pads on the delicate paint of my guitar and they worked perfectly!👍
customer_reviews.text: I have these guys 5 stars, because I did not use this product on a car. Instead I used it on very delicate paint of my guitars. There are 2 packets with various options and pads which was perfect because I was going to use more than mere wax. I highly recommend this product if you are gonna just do a wax, or if you are finishing up a project but your guitar needs the buff, scratch filler, hard wax and soft wax, these pads are the ones to get, you won't regret it!👍👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Art Martinez

customer_reviews.title: They held up well
customer_reviews.text: For some small 3'' pads they work extremely well. I used them along with some Cerium Oxide to totally make my windshield on my 1970 Dodge Charger 500 look new again. My window had large scratches from some old wiper blades. Thought I was gonna need a new windshield but using this product, an electric drill, some cerium oxide I was able to buffout them scratches . I only used two of the pads and they glass is just gleaming. The pads held up great. Very recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Bazaldua

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on stainless steel and automotive paint
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with these pads. I used them for buffing/polishing stainless steel and they work 10 times better than pads that I found in local stores for half the price also, if you use all 4 stages of pads on whatever your project is then I promise, you will be happy with the end result
customer_reviews.author: Deezznutzz

customer_reviews.title: Buy this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!!!! Holy cow! I was debating on dropping the $150-$200 to Detail my motorcycle. I took a chance with this product and tested it on my wife’s white SUV first since she had black scuff marks on it. Took the scuffs right off within seconds. More than what i expexted. Attached to your power drill, apply your solution to your car, and watch the black scuffs come off your car or motorcycle. 100% satisfied and will recommend. Hopefully the Velcro holds up for a long time. Either way, great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Sant

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Any Application
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I had some minor scratches around my car door handle and these worked perfectly along with a little bit of polish. All scratches easily buffed out. It worked so good I used these to wax my entire car. Very Easy to use, can use with any drill. Quality and Price are unbeatable. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MattChicago

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why so many people are complaining about the quality of the pads and them falling apart. Yes they are cheap but you get 2 drill attachments which makes it worth the money. The pads can be replaced with better quality ones down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value - great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these with only the photos and reviews to go by, and I'm glad I did. They're high quality and stay on without worry. I abused the first pad and it STILL didn't even show signs of wear - just kept on polishing. Great product and it came with two pouches of matching pads. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Gary DeBro

customer_reviews.title: Buff'N Shine
customer_reviews.text: I used these pads along with some polish to repair my scuffed semi headlight. Once I sanded down the area and commenced to buffing the pads worked wonders. Great price and plenty of pads to spare.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Lots of goodies with no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I I bought this kit to polish some plastics and it seemed to do the trick. However, this kit came with zero instructions or labels on to identify what each pad is used for. Don't get me wrong the quality is pretty good but it would have been nice to get a little help in figuring out what pad to use for each step of the 3 step polish process.
customer_reviews.author: Chest Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed my clear coat first time!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this please. It’s so cheap and leaves crazy swirl marks in my clear coat now and looks horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Sean sebrechts

customer_reviews.title: Not for electric polisher da or sa
customer_reviews.text: These are useless for any electric polisher. They only provide adapters for use in an electric drill which would be awkward. They would be more useful in a polisher but that requires a threaded male end on both ends. Why they provide only smooth shaft drill adapters makes little sense. I purchased two of these sets months ago and can't use them!
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Anchor

customer_reviews.title: Great Wax Kit
customer_reviews.text: My wife had several scratches in her vehicle that needed to be buffed out. I did not want to spend hundreds of dollars on a buffing kit, so instead, I bought this kit to attach to my cordless drill. I was very impressed with how well the attachments worked. All of the scratches came out. The only advice I give is that it took longer than you would think to get everything out as it is a process. This kit was a great compromise for my use of it but if you're in the auto detailing business, obviously you might want to go with the full deal kit.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Great value. And they really work!
customer_reviews.text: You get a TON of pads! I buffed my third brake light bar on my 300zx and it looks so nice now. All of my other pads are too big and get polish all in the crevices where I don't want it. These work great on a drill. Just be careful when using a drill as it will burn through the paint more than a DA will.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great for headlight restoration and glass polishing
customer_reviews.text: l bought this 3” kit with a little concern about quality. However after using it I can see it’s a well made kit. I will use it for headlight restoration and polishing automotive chrome, glass and mirrors. It would also could be good for spot paint corrections. Note: Make sure you wash and inspect the pads before use, as instructed!
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: They work great !
customer_reviews.text: Great product for polishing your motorcycle especially if you have more than one, cuts your time down on all that elbow grease. Pads are very easy to work with, and last very well still on my first two pads 3 motorcycles done one to go.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN RUBI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product & price!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked excellent! Exactly what I was hoping for & needed. High quality & highly competitive price. Great service & speedy shipping. I found another site with an almost identical product, but they were going to charge almost double plus take almost a month to ship. My only complaint is that the product didn’t come with labels as to what pads did what. This should be included with your product. I had to print it out from the amazon site. Not too big a deal but just a suggestion for improving customer service a tad more.
customer_reviews.author: David Pecchia

customer_reviews.title: Quality is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: The pads received an average durability rating, because I had two of the velcro backings tear off from the sponges. Three others are performing fine. Value for the money is rated at a 4, because I only received 1 shank/head set instead of the advertised 2. I even considered a 3, but you do receive two sponge sets.
customer_reviews.author: JDCowboyup

customer_reviews.title: better for cleaning tile/grout
customer_reviews.text: It does what they’re described to do. It’s a good value. I’ve used them to polish my car 4 times and found it cumbersome at the 90 degree angle of a drill. That’s not the fault of the product itself. The different density of foam and pattern was helpful when trying to buff tile and clean grout with bleach. It was better at cleaning tile/grout than polishing a car for what it’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: mattersiam

customer_reviews.title: Used to polish headlights
customer_reviews.text: Used for polishing final stages after sanding to restore two headlights and taillights. Worked great for those. I wouldn’t use to do a larger project such as a engine hood. Great for smaller projects. I washed after use with warm water and they seem ready for reuse. I would change their use as the foam probably absorbs the media used and it would be very difficult to completely clean from it
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great for small surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good product for you to polish or wax all around your car, you still can but it might take a lot of your time. But it is GREAT for removing scratches or small surfaces. I highly recommend this product for those who wants to use the drill. My car had various scratches on some areas because of the car was and it helped me a lot to get rid of scratches. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ugur

customer_reviews.title: A lot of performance for little price
customer_reviews.text: I use this to polish countertops and clean porcelain. Works great on a cordless drill. Eventually the velcro pad will tear off the foam and render it useless. If you are careful they will last for quite a few applications. At this price, I just toss them afterwards and grab a new one. My only complaint would be that I need the pads all at one stiffness not a variety.
customer_reviews.author: George J. Novak

customer_reviews.title: Used Junk
customer_reviews.text: This item had been opened and used. Clearly it didn’t work for someone else, but I tried it anyway. Junk. The Velcro does not stick. It comes flying off the drill. Headlights were not polished.
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product. I ordered these to use in polishing ...
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know what to expect, so I wasn't expecting much. Much to my surprise, this is a good product. I ordered these to use in polishing auto/truck headlights. You receive two complete sets of pads and drill attachment. I was able to buff out two vehicles and only used two pads. As I said, I was very surprised with the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Radioguy

customer_reviews.title: Two of everything you need!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice buy! Polishing pads are nicer than expected! Nicely packaged, basically two complete kits, polished my headlights so far with very good results!
customer_reviews.author: One busy guy!

customer_reviews.title: Works great, need pad order for polishing
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice with using them but they are doing g the job, I just wish I knew which one is for what, in what order do I use the different pad, they go from soft to firm, I personally don’t know which one to use for what so I’m guessing, great pad set up, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: AL Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great pad kit for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a good value and was useful for what I needed them for. I wanted to clean my headlight lens and with a little Turtlewax headlight restoration and sealer they did fine. One of the thin pads attached to the main pad fell off after use. So that would be the only negative, but it lasted along time!
customer_reviews.author: Mike in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: he came in to show me what a good job they had done
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these.He is using them for buffing up his surfboard repairs. He was so excited with the results, he came in to show me what a good job they had done. I was impressed.I will use them to keep my car headlights bright,( as they tend to get damaged by the sun). Great product, very fast shipping, too.
customer_reviews.author: Pelley

customer_reviews.title: Works good for guitars
customer_reviews.text: I got these for guitar finishes. I've found using the 3inch shaft with a 5inch pad helps around edges without worry of burning through. The quality of the pads and makers of them change so often so it's hit and miss but normally usable to cut or just polish small areas.
customer_reviews.author: JASON

customer_reviews.title: Why the different colors?
customer_reviews.text: Good price, however there is no guidance to what the different colored pads are for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to polish headlights
customer_reviews.text: Good set, no way could I find something like this locally for the price. It basically two sealed sets which I like because sand and stuff wont get in all the polishers. Pretty neat, glad I picked this up. I am going to try buffing out some scratches in another car and see if there is any improvement.
customer_reviews.author: DJK

customer_reviews.title: Not for car
customer_reviews.text: To use this on your car with your cordless drill isn’t very feasible. You can’t control the speed well and the pad is so small. I went back to hand waxing.
customer_reviews.author: Chad R. Schuitema

customer_reviews.title: worked great on tight area needing compounding
customer_reviews.text: Used to get into tight areas after paint repair and color sanding. Cleaned up and polished spot repair with rubbing compound. What I didn't like was no explanation as to the colors of the pads and what they should be used with (rubbing compound, polishing compound, Polish ??).
customer_reviews.author: Pamela F.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I’m gonna put this as simply as I can... the backing comes off in the first hand wash, which makes them a SINGLE USE ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: NGchicago

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pads to use for cleaning and polishing my headlights on my 08 Malibu and they worked really well just the right size and easy to use, they are very durable even after finishing both headlights the pads still looks great so grab some of these and you will find they are very versatile in many ways I highly recommend these to anyone needing them
customer_reviews.author: Randy Brewer ThD

customer_reviews.title: Car Foam Drill Polishing Pad Kit 22 PCS, 3 Inch Buffing Pads
customer_reviews.text: I and surprised at the quality of this product as well as usefulness of the buffer pads that are 3 inches in size, they are perfect for the small jobs as well as the tight places. I am happy with these pads and will be the same again when they are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Genelyn Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a drill. I polished headlights with a bit of plastic polish after wet sanding. The DIY headlight kits are usually $15-20 and a one time use type product. I used one to polish the stainless steel in my kitchen. I wouldn't polish paint with a drill though, it may fit other tools better suited for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Hold Together
customer_reviews.text: This set was a good price, but after using I wish I had purchased a better set. Two of the pads came off the backing very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Darci Andrews

customer_reviews.title: make sure your drill is charged.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about this hit but worked great. Don't mind the lense its dirty from the inside.
customer_reviews.author: David Fonseca

customer_reviews.title: Great with any power drill
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after buying an orbital buffer, and these worked so much better than the orbital buffer did. They are small enough to get into smaller areas between fenders and windows or soft tops ( like a Jeep Wrangler or older rag top car ).
customer_reviews.author: Andy E

customer_reviews.title: This buffing-pad kit shines!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a polishing pad kit to restore the shine to my vehicle’s headlights. This inexpensive kit includes two sets of hook & loop buffing pads. Each set includes five pads of different different hardness; I used three different pads and my variable-speed random orbit polisher to cut buff ad polish my car’s headlights to “like new” condition.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Directions Nill.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. Would be nice if there was an instruction booklet telling you what each one was for. I had to look it up.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher David

customer_reviews.title: Must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I used them to fix my headlights. Fantastic and easy. You never need to buy one of those kits. I used Maguires compound. I was so thrilled that I worked on a couple of scratches and got those out too. A must have, and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Camp

customer_reviews.title: Realy the orange and white pads work fine and are the ones you use
customer_reviews.text: OK Kit. Really the orange and white pads work fine and are the ones you use. Other pads are really soft. Washed several times and are holding up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Penpen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great kit. It's inexpensive but handy tool. Every car owners should buy this product. It has multiple use. This weekend I spent few hours with my car and I fixed some minor issues like removing scratches, restoring headlights. Compounding , polishing , waxing and buffing. My work made easy.. Now my car shines like new. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's not made for the whole car just small areas
customer_reviews.text: These little guys aren't bad.. it's really no made to do a whole car with.. but small areas. I used the on my mack.. polishing the aluminium wheels.. it did fine.. got the door jams and all to do next.. so I'll use these to buff them with and when the wheels need it again.. I'll do it again.. I'll be making and order again pretty soon
customer_reviews.author: Tree trucker

customer_reviews.title: To small to do anything
customer_reviews.text: They are to small to use and fall apart. It is way easier just use a cloth towel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Big Help
customer_reviews.text: I used the orange cutting pad on my dingy oxidized headlights. It worked great! The only downside is I need new orange cutting pads. I would buy this product again. When I was working on my headlights all the neighbors came out to watch and were amazed at the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to polish my gloss black wheels. They worked perfectly and the results were excellent. Not sure if durability, but even if I get a couple uses out of each pad it'll be worth it. One orange pad held up great doing all four wheels.
customer_reviews.author: B Mo

customer_reviews.title: Quality, useful sponges
customer_reviews.text: The drill attachment was good. The sponges seemed to be good quality. Worked well to shine my car, rims, and a small repair job. The only downside is that the sponges aren't attached too well to the "fuzzy felt" backing. They started to come off after the first use and rinsing of sponges. More of a disposable set than a keeper. Pretty good value though, as I expect to get another use or two out of the sponges
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to friends and family
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use great product for everyone headlight cleaning, glass buffing, stainless polishing, personally i use this to clean my welding hood lens, and helmet. I used to use this same clean tactic on my motorcycle helmet.
customer_reviews.author: Stevan M.

customer_reviews.title: Works ok.
customer_reviews.text: This works ok. Nothing amazing. Still could see the small tree branch runner scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Crawford

customer_reviews.title: What a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I used these pads on my car to remove a sude mirror scratch on the side of my car’s door. I used Chemical Guys v34 and then v38, The pads worked cery well, removed the paint transfer in 5 minutes. You get 2 sets with this purchase!!! That’s an amazing deal!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rutkowski

customer_reviews.title: Good tools for waxing the car overall
customer_reviews.text: I have a drill at home so that I bought this tool for waxing my car. However, the quality of some of the piece is not that good. After I waxed the whole car, the pad is broken at the bottom. It was not happen on every pad, which is so good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Reused Many Times, Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t worried about the reviews stating these fall apart... did you forget how much you paid for them? For a cheap solution, these work very well. Polished my headlights and used swirl remover on the paint. Have hand washed and reused many times! Of course, like any product, I’d you run it over sharp edges or a car badge and run it too dry or with extreme pressure, you’re going to damage it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C.

customer_reviews.title: I love um.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. I grabbed new strings, Dunlop platinum 65 cleaner and wax and some fret board oil. And I use these 3inch ones to keep up on my guitars. I also use them after I paint a project guitar. . And they’ll actually help get rid of small blemishes And any of ur rough spots your gonna have, cause u don’t really know how to paint. I’ll end up buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: More than enough
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional car polisher. I have used the pads a few times to polish my headlight and I don't see any issues or deterioration. I will definitely purchase again but probably not for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fantastic price!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to buff my car and headlight covers. These pads are great because they come with the attachment for my drill. No special equipment needed. The pads attach with strong Velcro. I think this product is perfect for my needs and I was surprised at how inexpensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda musick

customer_reviews.title: Foam Pads for Polishing
customer_reviews.text: They're foam pads for polishing headlights/detailing/spot touch-up. No wheel pad and not made for whole car, but seem fine for intended use. Probably work well on M/C, bicycle or other small jobs. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: G L Sav

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: works great. it attaches quickly to my hand drill. the adhesive backing has held up. i've only used it to compound my headlights but i love it. i'm not looking for a professional grade quality or price. it works great for what i need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: key-point

product_meta.title: Car Foam Drill Polishing Pad Kit 22 PCS, 3 Inch Buffing Pads
feature_bullets: Package Includes 16pcs 3" Sponge Polishing Pads, 2pcs Woolen Buffer Pads, 2pcs Drill Adapter, 2pcs Suction Cup.

Suitable: Used for all kinds of coat paints's waxing, polishing and sealing glaze, to clean and improve their lightness; And for auto car detail polishing. Adhesive backing, you can change pads just in seconds.

High Quality: Prime quality wool pad, sponge pad, bendable, washable and reusable. Different colored sponges have different softness, you can choose as you need, suitable for polishing rough and small areas.

Professional wool and foam pad buffing, polishing and finishing system. Efficient cutting and polishing the most difficult car oxidation coating, scratches. Can be used in pneumatic or electric polishing machine.
All sponge polishing pads should be cleaned and leveled before use to ensure that there are no particles left. After use, polishers should be cleaned immediately and dried in a cool place.

specifications.Special Features: Drill polishing kit, Polishing pads, Buffing wheel for drill, Buffing pads, Polishing pad
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,177 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
